Definition: PUDL plant id. Allows some linkage between FERC & EIA Data.
EIA Plant Identification number. One to five digit numeric.
EIA Plant name.
Name of entity which operates the plant; from EIA923 records.
US state in which the plant is located.
Data year.
Generator identification code by plant.
The EIA fuel code associated with the fuel receipt: https://www.eia.gov/electricity/2008forms/aaqs_923.html
fuel_quantity * average_heat_content (for plants w/ multiple energy sources: number of mmbtu of given energy source for a plant in a given year)
fuel_quantity * average_heat_content (for plants w/ one energy source: number of mmbtu for the plant in a given year)
fuel_quantity * average_heat_content * fuel_cost_per_mmbtu  (for plants w/ multiple energy sources: total dollars spent on an energy source for a given plant in a given year)
fuel_quantity * average_heat_content * fuel_cost_per_mmbtu  (for plants w/ one energy source: total dollars spent on fuel by a given plant in a given year)
fuel_quantity * average_heat_content * fuel_cost_per_mmbtu  (by PUDL Plant ID for direct comarison with fuel costs in FERC: expns_fuel)
(fuel_cost_es)/(mmbtu_es)
(fuel_cost_plant)/(mmbtu_plant)

(fuel_cost_per_mmbtu)/(heat_rate_mmbtu_mwh); (for plants w/ one energy source: fuel_cost_per_mmbtu_plant used; for plants w/ multiple energy sources: fuel_cost_per_mmbtu_es used; heat rates are generator-specific.
(fuel_qty_consumed * fuel_mmbtu_per_unit) total heat content of all fuels consumed by the plant for a given year
‘proportion_of_gen_by_boiler_gen’ * ‘fuel_consumed_mmbtu’
'net generation per boiler/generator combination by merging generators923 tab with boiler_generator_association860 tab on ''plant_id''; ''report_date''; ''boiler_id'' & ''generator_id'''
'''net_generation_mwh_boiler_gen''/ ''net_generation_mwh_boiler'''
(fuel_consumed_mmbtu_per_gen / net_generation_mwh_boiler_gen) Overall heat rate for each generator in MMBTU per Mwh of net generation.

True (value = 1) means that those generator/boilers have been a part of a completely associated plant. This way we could keep units that have been associated in the past together when there is a non-completely documented unit added.

True (value = 1) if for the plant/year all of the generators are associated (a plant that has all it’s boiler generators associated); False (value = 0) if generator data exists that is not mapped to a boiler in the boiler generator association table in EIA860.
Net electricity generation in Mwh for a generator (includes all fuels)
Total Mwh of generation for an EIA plant ID in a year
Total Mwh of generation for a PUDL plant ID in a year (to compare with net_generation_mwh_plant from FERC)
The highest value on the generator nameplate in megawatts rounded to the nearest tenth.
The net summer capacity.
The net winter capacity.
(net_generation_mwh_generator) / (nameplate_capacity_mw * 8760) [8760 hours in a year]
Year for which the data was reported.
FERC respondent (utility) ID.
PUDL utility id. Allows some linkage between FERC & EIA Data.
FERC respondent name.
Name of the power plant as reported to FERC.
Total installed capacity. Maximum generation nameplate rating in MW.
Year originally constructed.
Year last unit was installed.
Net peak demand on plant in MW.
Net continuous plant capacity when limited by condenser water in MW.
Net continuous plant capacity when not limited by condenser water in MW.
Plant hours connected to load.
Net generation exclusive of plant use in MWh.
Production expenses: operation supervision & engineering.
Total fuel expenses.
Coolants and water (Nuclear plants only).
Steam expenses.
Steam from other sources.
Steam transferred (Circulation Ratio).
Electric expenses.
Miscellaneous steam (or nuclear) power expenses.
Rents.
Allowances.
Maintenance supervision and engineering.
Maintenance of structures.
Maintenance of boiler (or reactor) plant.
Maintenance of electric plant.
Maintenance of miscellaneous steam (or nuclear) plant.
If correlation of an expns field with net_generation_mwh is >0.5 then that expense field is considered a "production" cost. (see ‘Expense Correlations’ tab for values)
expns_total / net_generation_mwh
Total of all non-fuel expns_ fields having >= 0.5 correlation with net_generation_mwh across the entire dataset.
Total of all expns_ fields that having < 0.5 correlation with net_generation_mwh.
